stories.text:
Currently, at http://spotlyt.cloud/ we are building a tool and API that enables developers build good search infrastructure for their platform be it a website, app or documentation. We are basically not focusing on owning and defining consumer experience, but focusing on the simplicity of search from development perspective just so developers can do more with less amount of code.

We need sort of guidance and opinion from the community and we'd love you to share ideas with us, mainly around the problems you face building or implementing search.

You can also recommend features too!
stories.title: Ask HN: Issues you have with building or maintaining your search infrastructure?

stories.text:
If you are not going through YC and raising your own funds, recessions are a great time to vet VCs.

Most VCs during this time quiver and grow timid and scared.

They do not have confidence in their network, in their mentorship or their determination.

However there are a few VCs who are not like the above.

Finding them is easier during this time because everyone else is not pretending.

Find them and raise capital from them. One of the many boons of a market downturn for building a startup.
stories.title: Recessions are when you find the best VCs
